wikipedia_page.main: Sir Robert Romney Kane, Bt (1842–1902) was an Irish barrister and legal writer. He wrote also on Irish history.

response: * Robert Romney Kane (1842–1902), Irish barrister and legal writer

Kane married Katherine Sophia Baily on 23 August 1838, with whom he had seven surviving children. Kane's eldest son Robert Romney Kane was known as a barrister. The second son, Henry Coey Kane, became an admiral in the Royal Navy.

* Lectures on the History of Ireland; two series, 1869, 1870; the first was a course delivered at Alexandra College, Dublin, and covered the history of Ireland down to 1534; the second was delivered at Trinity College and went as far as the plantation of Ulster. These lectures, together with other lectures, were collected in A Short History of the Irish People, down to the Plantation of Ulster (1887), edited, after Richey's death, by Robert Romney Kane, with one  chapter of a detailed history of Ireland.
The Kanes had seven surviving children, including Robert Romney Kane and Henry Coey Kane. She died 25 February 1886 in Dublin.
